Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on free speech and democratic rights.
The bill targets ordinary Australians rather than addressing the root causes of misinformation.
The bill could be used to cover up government corruption and misconduct.
The complexity of the bill imposes unrealistic restraints on free speech.
The bill does not address organized groups that spread misinformation for political purposes.
Notable Quotes: The Combating Misinformation Disinformation Bill before the Parliament of Australia is the opposite because it attacks individual people instead of protecting them.
The unnecessary complexity in the Bill denies ordinary Australians their right to free speech and to our democratic right of enquiry.
The said Bill is extremely dangerous as per the above circumstances.
The Combating Misinformation Disinformation Bill does not target that political and Tall Story group or maybe other groups that are organized in a somewhat cold war military fashion.
